Stem: Scientists have studied the relationship between cattle egrets and cattle in pastures across the world. Cattle egrets are white birds that follow cattle as they graze and move through grassy fields. When cattle walk through vegetation, they disturb insects hiding in the grass, causing them to move or fly away from their hiding places. The egrets then catch and eat these insects that would otherwise remain hidden. Research has shown that while egrets clearly benefit from this feeding opportunity, the cattle show no measurable changes in health, stress levels, or behavior whether the birds are present or absent. Scientists have conducted controlled studies comparing cattle with and without egrets present and found no significant differences in the cattle's weight gain, insect burden, or overall well-being. What BEST describes the symbiotic relationship between cattle egrets and cattle when the birds follow the cattle around in fields?
Choices: A) The egrets feed on insects stirred up by the cattle, and the cattle also benefit by having fewer insects around them. This represents a mutualistic relationship where both species benefit., B) The egrets feed on insects stirred up by the cattle, while the cattle are harmed by having birds constantly following them. This represents a parasitic relationship where one organism benefits while harming the other., C) The egrets feed on insects stirred up by the walking cattle, while the cattle are neither helped nor harmed by the birds' presence. This represents a commensal relationship where one organism benefits while the other is unaffected. D The Rainbow Bay Marine Park has seen an increase in whale watching tourism over the past few years. This has led to
